intro: Cousinia splendida, commonly known as the splendid cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold, arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Cousinia splendida is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
